current.name: Mike Smith
current.blurb: My research interests are focussed on how the interactions between particles affect the properties of non-equilibrium flows. This spans colloidal and granular systems, both with and without wetting liquids. I'm particularly interested in questions related to the arrest of flowing matter: glassy dynamics, jamming, fracture

current.name: Oliver Lunn
current.blurb: Oliver is working on a PhD using 2D vibrated granular particles to study phase transitions, including the novel rise of interfacial tension at liquid-crystal interfaces

past.name: Juno Hayes
past.blurb: Juno worked on an Industry linked PhD project studying the break-up of yield stress fluids. e.g clay.

past.name: James Downs
past.blurb: James worked on a PhD project looking at crystallization in 2D granular fluids.

past.name: Nathan Smith
